qas.question: In what year did the Third Ecumenical Council occur in Ephesus?
Whose teachings were addressed at the Third Ecumenical Council?
What does the phrase "Mater Dei" mean?
What are the two Latin equivalents of the Greek term "Theokotos?"
What is the literal translation of Theokotos?
In what year did Mary attend the Third Ecumenical Council?
What is the name of the Council where Mary meet Nestorius?
What language was spoken by Nestorius?
What language was spoken by the Church Fathers?
When did Mary meet the Church Fathers?

context: Mary is referred to by the Eastern Orthodox Church, Oriental Orthodoxy, the Anglican Church, and all Eastern Catholic Churches as Theotokos, a title recognized at <b6_0>the Third Ecumenical Council<b6_0/> (held at Ephesus to address the teachings of <a1_0>Nestorius<a1_0/>, <b9_0>in <a0_0><b5_0>431<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>). Theotokos (and its Latin equivalents, <a3_0>"Deipara" and "Dei genetrix"<a3_0/>) literally means "<a4_0>Godbearer<a4_0/>". The equivalent phrase "Mater Dei" (<a2_0>Mother of God<a2_0/>) is more common in <b7_0>Latin<b7_0/> and so also in the other languages used in the Western Catholic Church, but this same phrase in <b8_0>Greek<b8_0/> (Μήτηρ Θεοῦ), in the abbreviated form of the first and last letter of the two words (ΜΡ ΘΥ), is the indication attached to her image in Byzantine icons. The Council stated that the Church Fathers "did not hesitate to speak of the holy Virgin as the Mother of God".
